info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MCDOWELL COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 232 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Marion, or 5 miles east of B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, Lake James, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Nebo, North Cove, Pleasant Gardens, Little Switzerland, Woodlawn, and Busick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
